channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPR-1951] NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor in CVS does not match M4 distribution
item.description:
While upgrading from M3 to M4
org.springframework.aop.support.NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor caused a failure in our Spring context file.
Comparing CVS to the source in the M4 distribution shows a significant difference.

No setter found for property 'classFilter' in class 'org.springframework.aop.support.NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor'

http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/springframework/spring/src/org/springframework/aop/support/NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor.java?rev=1.11&view=markup

M4 src tree

    */

package org.springframework.aop.support;

import org.aopalliance.aop.Advice;

import org.springframework.aop.Pointcut;
import org.springframework.aop.PointcutAdvisor;
import org.springframework.core.Ordered;
import org.springframework.util.ObjectUtils;

/**

  • Convenient class for name-match method pointcuts that hold an Interceptor,
  • making them an Advisor.
    *
  • @author Juergen Hoeller
  • @author Rob Harrop
    */
    public class NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor extends AbstractPointcutAdvisor {

private final NameMatchMethodPointcut pointcut = new NameMatchMethodPointcut();

public NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor() {
}

public NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor(Advice advice)

{ setAdvice(advice); }

public Pointcut getPointcut()

{ return this.pointcut; }

public boolean isPerInstance()

{ throw new UnsupportedOperationException("perInstance property of Advisor is not yet supported in Spring"); }

public NameMatchMethodPointcut addMethodName(String name)

{ return this.pointcut.addMethodName(name); }

public void setMappedName(String mappedName)

{ this.pointcut.setMappedName(mappedName); }

public void setMappedNames(String[] mappedNames)

{ this.pointcut.setMappedNames(mappedNames); }

}
item.summary: NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor in CVS does not match M4 distribution

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The same happened with org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAttributeSourceAdvisor for example.

Until now its superclass was StaticMethodMatcherPointcutAdvisor (now org.springframework.aop.support.AbstractPointcutAdvisor at least in the 2.0M4 distribution).

This has the consequence that is not possible to set a org.springframework.aop.ClassFilter instance for the advisor.

Like mentioned above CVS and the source in the M4 distribution shows a significant difference.

This is probably caused by a recent refactoring that Rob did, and I assume the consequences are expected. I'll let the expert himself speak on that

Regarding the mismatch with CVS: The M4 distribution does correspond to the current developer CVS content as far as I am aware of. I rather suspect that you compared the M4 files to an old CVS view. Note that SourceForge's public CVS has been broken for a couple of weeks...

Juergen

Unfortunately this is a necessary change to allow for more efficient caching of proxy class instances when using CGLIB. For this to work effectively and correctly, we need to be able to determine equals() equivalence for Pointcut instances. For equals() to be implemented correctly on both NameMatchMethodPointcut and NameMatchMethodPointcutAdvisor it would mean that the an instance of each with the same mappedNames but different Advice instances would not be considered equal(). This means that the user's configuration choices would have a large impact on proxy class caching, something that I didn't really want to be the case.

So to rectify this I moved away from inheritance towards composition instead (equals contracts being one of many reasons why composition should be preferred). I knew this would have some impacts - I was just waiting to hear of them

I've added a setClassFilter() method to NMMPA and TSAA which delegates into the pointcut class which should fix your issues.

Regards,

Rob
